comment._content: May be a bit seedy, but it has a TV antenna!

comment.author: 22652858@N07
comment._content: I'd like to definitively say that this is the old part of Oregon Hill that no longer exists, and it probably is. But, it may also be Church Hill.

comment.author: 36332614@N08
comment._content: Ye Olde Oregon Hill still exists in photo's. Looks like 611 South Belvidere Street, built 1860 and no longer standing. East side of Belv. St. at corner of Rowe & Belv. Street. See page 208, Old Richmond Neighborhoods by Mary Wingfield Scott. 609 Belv. in background with a barber shop at rear and 1 story frame building 615 Belv. in foreground per 1905 Sanborn map. 609 is also frame with asphalt brick siding much popular in 1940's. Tardus knows history of barber that lived in 609 Belv.

comment.author: 35999382@N00
comment._content: Bravo to Greg and  Prof. Elliott for the identification of This Old House!

comment._content: Hey Charles how is the old place holding up?
